qas.question: How did the Russians communicate to the Germans in regards to bombing soldiers trying to flee cities?
What day did German leave Poland?
What day did German invade France?
How long didn't the Germans massacre Polish and Jewish civilians?

context: On <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>1 September<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>, Germany invaded Poland from the west. Within the first few days of the invasion, Germany began conducting massacres of Polish and Jewish civilians and POWs. These executions took place in over 30 towns and villages in the <b7_0>first <a2_0>month<a2_0/> of German occupation<b7_0/>. The Luftwaffe also took part by strafing fleeing civilian refugees on roads and carrying out a bombing campaign. The Soviet Union assisted German air forces by allowing them to use <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>signals broadcast by the Soviet radio<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> station at Minsk allegedly "for urgent aeronautical experiments".
